article.title: Installing Custom Scenery
article.para: Installing Custom Scenery is not a difficult task. There are a few things to consider though, like what file extension the pack might be in among other things. Here is a walkthrough for those who need help.

important.para: In the following tutorial <RCT3 dir> will be used as a placeholder for the directory you installed RCT3 to. Most commonly this is

section.title: Downloading Custom Scenery
section.para: The first thing needed to know is how to get Custom Scenery, or CS for short.

The largest way to get these sets is to download them from a third-party uploader, such as Rapidshare or Megaupload. Both options have free downloading capability and good sets can remain in storage indefinitely.

Another option is to download from private servers hosted by many people from around the world. Both Vodhin and errt have great sites to download from and have a large selection of objects. One thing to keep in mind though, is that many of these servers require registration before you download any objects.

section.title: Unpacking Custom Scenery
section.para: Once you have downloaded the set, you need to unpack it.

There are three main formats that CS sets are downloaded in. The most common is in the .zip format and can be unzipped by most computers without having to download any extra software. The next most common is the .rar format, which requires 3rd party software to unpack. Only a few sets, such as MaxInfinity’s Gothic Wall set, are packaged as .rar files.
The third format is in the form of a downloaded executable file. Not too many sets are downloaded in this manner; there are too many unknowns to make this an efficient method.
Occasionally, you might find a set that is an executable packaged as a .zip for memory reasons. Just unzip it, and run the executable.

The best place to unpack your downloaded CS sets is to set aside a folder on the desktop to download them to. You can have folders within that folder that contain unopened sets and keep the original downloads if the set becomes corrupt for some reason.
Do NOT unpack or download your CS sets into the <RCT3 dir>\Style\Themed folder as this is the leading cause of errors.

After the CS set is unpackaged in a designated spot, open the folder with the set’s name. You should see two or more .ovl files and a few folders, the number depending on the number of objects in the set. If you only see a folder with the name of the set on it, then copy that folder into your storage spot (if necessary renaming the OUTER folder ONLY).
Check to see if the required files are in there.

After this point, check to see if a ReadMe folder was downloaded. If so, READ IT! There are a few sets, such as Disfan1’s table set and Nuclear Fish’s Particle Effects set that have specific installation instructions in them. Not following them can lead to hours of wasted time trying to get the set to work.

Only after all of this work is done place the folder with the necessary files in your <RCT3 dir>\Style\Themed folder. Simply copy and paste it into there. The set should be installed and accessible when you start up RCT3 next.

section.title: Game appears to hang
section.para:
On many errors the game appears to hang. This is caused by a normal Windows message hidden behind the game's graphic screen. Use Alt
Tab to get to your Windows desktop and see the actual error message.

section.title: The vaunted no :siv: for :sid: error
section.para: This error simply states that there was an incorrect installation. The culprit, almost every single time is having an extra folder hiding the scenery items from being accessed by the game. Simply remove the outer folder (do NOT RENAME THE INNER FOLDER) and the set should run.

section.title: The scenery does not appear in game
section.para: If the scenery does not appear in game,

listitem.para: Make sure ALL of the scenery filters are enabled.
Make sure you looked everywhere and not only where you expect it to be. For example old sets are often found among the walls.
If you had RCT3 runnig when you installed the set, restart it. Sometimes it's possible to install CS when RCT3 is running, but sometimes it doesn't work.

Make sure it is installed in the correct place, namely <RCT3 dir>\Style\Themed. If the set was distributed as an executable installer it is possible that it created another directory with or without the ® symbol in the Program Files/Atari folder (as mentioned above Gold! and non-US users are particularly vulnerable to this) and the CS got installed in the wrong directory.

title.quote: You do not have sufficient access rights to open…

section.para: This problem is currently (14.12.2006) exclusive (to my knowledge) to Nuclear Fish’s Particle Effects pack. It is a result of improper installation. Read the enclosed ReadMe or his thread on the Atari forums for the solution to this problem which usually is a result of incorrect installation of the particle effects of the set. (thanks to ckfour for the pic :-P)

section.title: You have two copies of the set running in the game, but only one folder with the files in your <RCT3 dir>\Style\Themed folder
section.para: This is a simple issue from incorrect installation and an unfinished fix. This problem is a result of the nested folder issue but with a twist; the set was later correctly installed without removing the incorrect folder. Due to the way the game analyzes the .ovl files, two options are created in the RCT3 menu. To fix this problem, just remove the redundant, nested folder.
